results.title: Head of Recruitment
results.description:
Templum is a leading FinTech company focused on creating greater efficiencies in the alternative asset sector. While private markets have recently surpassed public markets as it pertains to annual capital raised the infrastructure remains opaque and inefficient. Templum has created an end-to-end solution for the primary issuance and secondary trading of private alternative assets catered to the needs of private market participants. 

We are looking for a dynamic and seasoned recruitment specialist who is as comfortable sourcing developers as they are C- level executives, who appreciates the unique impact they can have as an in-house TA lead, and who is above all, our #1 product enthusiast and evangelist.  

Responsibilities: 

  • Manage end to end strategic and delivery side of Sourcing & Recruiting, from prioritizing headcount planning to scheduling and leading interviews 
  • Collaborate with internal partners to build and execute tailored recruitment strategies on a per-role basis, while at the same time creating repeatable processes 
  • Use metrics to refine and improve upon strategy and process, from recruitment to post-hire 
  • Work with VP of People and other colleagues to perform headcount planning and forecasting 
  • Write job descriptions 
  • Review current interview process with an eye for consistency and compliance, staying ahead of statutory requirements and defining a unique, comprehensive, and positive experience for candidates across the board 
  • Manage social media accounts from a recruitment perspective; work with Marketing and VP of People to build a positive cultural brand 
  • Perform market research and leverage other data to establish and publish salary bands 
  • Build a pipeline of candidates for all potential roles across the organization 
  • Act as an escalation point to business stakeholders for all recruiting-related concerns 
  • Optimize recruiting databases and tools; implement new tools as deemed necessary for optimal efficiency and data analysis 
  • Perform other HR duties unrelated to recruitment as business needs demand them and in close collaboration with VP of People & Culture 

Preferred Skills & Experience 

  • Bachelor's Degree 
  • Passion for Alternative Investments and basic understanding of Capital Markets 
  • 1+ years experience recruiting for a Tech or FinTech firm, across both Tech and non-Tech functions 
  • 4+ years of total experience in recruitment 
  • Experience working with- and ideally implementing- a modern ATS such as Greenhouse, iCIMS, or BreezyHR 
  • Strong understanding of the company's business objectives and organizational structure 
  • Very good understanding of the company's position in the marketplace 
  • Strong understanding of recruiting processes and procedures 
  • Understanding and valuing of metrics and their function in your role 
  • Strong interviewing skills: understanding of human psychology and excellent interpersonal skills 
  • Understanding of recruiting resource and marketing plan 
  • Good understanding of the external marketplace trends 
  • Data analysis experience 
  • Strong team player 
  • Analytical skills and problem-solving skills 

Expected annual base salary for this role is between $100,000 and $130,000 at the commencement of employment. However, base salary, if hired, will be determined on an individualized basis and constitutes only one part of the total rewards and compensation package, which will include a 4% 401K match and health benefits subsidized at 75% by Templum. Depending on the position, total compensation may also include options, commission earnings, incentive compensation, and/or discretionary bonuses. Please note that ancillary benefits are subject to change at any time in the sole discretion of Templum.

Templum truly believes that diversity fosters innovation and we're proud to have a diverse team with a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We focus on hiring talented people regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Director, Product Management - Consumer Products
results.description:
Everly Health's mission is to transform lives with modern, diagnostics-driven care, and we believe that the future of healthcare is meeting people where they are. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Everly Health is the parent company to Everlywell, Everly Health Solutions, Natalist, and Everly Diagnostics. We've set a new standard of people-focused, diagnostic-driven care that puts patients at the center of their own health journey.
 
Our infrastructure guides the full testing experience with the support of a national clinician network that's composed of hundreds of physicians, nurses, genetic counselors, PharmDs, and member care specialists. Our solutions make world-class virtual care more attainable with rigorous clinical protocols and best-in-class science to tackle some of the healthcare industry's biggest problems.
 
Everly Health is looking for a  Director of Product Management to help drive strategy and execution for Consumer Products, as well as leading and growing a team of product managers. In this role you will build out strategic lines of business, scale existing product lines and make direct topline impact to Everly Health. You will manage, mentor and lead a team of existing product managers and hire to build out the product management organization. As a senior member of the leadership team, you’ll partner closely across design, engineering, marketing, clinical, enterprise, finance, business operations, and other stakeholder teams to develop a deep understanding of our customers and partners, and drive compelling solutions across the company. 
 



What You'll Do:
  • Lead a large team of product managers across all levels and work flawlessly with other leaders for projects with multiple cross functional teams
  • Drive alignment and effective problem resolution across the organization, including marketing, sales, clinical, and the Everly Health  leadership team
  • Leverage market analysis, competitive knowledge, and customer research to define and validate both a project strategy and detailed product plans for your areas of responsibility
  • Expeditiously shepherd the launch of new products by improving the speed and efficiency of product development and clinical processes
  • Work heavily with data to curate ideas and analysis to answer a question and/or build out a revenue impacting business case
  • Define and analyze product metrics to inform decision-making and measure success
  • Develop business models and plans to achieve company OKRs (i.e., revenue growth, user engagement, retention, LTV, etc) 
  • Identify, develop, and lead breakthroughs in playbooks and processes that drive more efficiency, effectiveness, and happiness in how we operate as a product team and engage with other parts of the organization
  • Develop and communicate product requirements as well as a coherent roadmap. Facilitate the same for your teams. Work with product managers, designers, researchers, product marketers and engineers to ensure successful envisioning and delivery of new features and functionality
  • Manage on time delivery of the Consumer Products roadmap 
  • Keep stakeholders informed by regularly sharing progress on existing product initiatives as well as future roadmap plans
  • Recruit / hire, manage, mentor, and grow teams of product managers, collaborating with you on all of the above
  • Remain knowledgeable about the competitive landscape and influence product direction to remain competitive in the market



Who You Are:
  • 9+ years of experience in product management at a top consumer technology company or consumer focused healthcare or health- tech company 
  • 4+ years of direct management experience in growing product teams and career pathing for individuals and managers 
  • MBA or Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Healthcare  or related field or equivalent work experience
  • Strong and focused leader, team player, thought leader  and consensus builder
  • Highly compassionate for customers and team members
  • Management expertise 
  • Ability to drive multiple initiative from concept to execution with perfect go to market execution 
  • Analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Excellent presentation skills 
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent interface skills with Executive Leadership Teams 
  • Ability to work tactically in a fast-paced, start-up-like environment
  • Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to work on and manage multiple projects, teams and goals simultaneously
  • Development or design experience is a plus
The base salary range for this role is $159,797 - $177,552 USD. The actual salary offered will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications, market data/ranges, and internal equity. This position is also eligible for a yearly bonus.
 
You'll Love Working Here:
 
· Venture backed by top-tier firms
· The opportunity ahead knows no bounds
· Open vacation policy for salaried team members
· Front Loaded PTO for hourly team members
· Employee discounts
· Paid parental leave
· Health benefits
· 401(k)
 
NO EXTERNAL RECRUITERS - INDIVIDUAL APPLICANTS ONLY
 
Everly Health is committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, age, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.
 
HIPAA Disclaimer: This role will be in an environment that has access to protected health information (PHI) and all security standards to protect PHI must be followed.

results.title: Student Success Manager
results.description:
DESCRIPTION

Fullstack Academy is the premier technology skills accelerator providing immersive, intensive, rapid courses (e.g. bootcamps) that bridge the skills gap between our students and employer partners. Fullstack Academy operates Fullstack-branded bootcamps in New York and nationally through University partners. Offering curricula in Web Development, Cybersecurity and other in-demand technologies, Fullstack Academy’s three- to six-month bootcamps have changed the lives of thousands of students and re-defined where employers are finding top talent.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Student Success Manager at Fullstack Academy, you will own the day-to-day activities and operations of classes at Fullstack Academy boot camps. This position will manage operations for technology courses, engaging with students and instructional staff to ensure an exceptional student experience.

This role is full-time and remote. Please note the ability to flex hours and work “second shift” is critical to support the classes and will be an expectation of the person in this role.

There are 2 shift positions available. You can be based in any time zone, but will be responsible for working during the hours below, depending on the position chosen:

  • Position 1: 9am-5pm PST
  • Position 2: 12pm-8pm PST (Fridays will be on an earlier schedule)

RESPONSIBILITIES
In this role, you will:

  • Serve as the initial primary point of contact for students between enrollment and cohort start
  • Conduct outreach to newly enrolled students to onboard them into class
  • Oversee day-to-day operations of several cohorts, to ensure we are delivering on our brand promise of an exceptional learning experience, including but not limited to:
    • Communicating with students who have unexcused absences
    • Withdrawing students from class
    • Creating rotating learning teams
    • Reviewing assessment scores to make sure we are catching any students falling behind
  • Resolve student issues (e.g. behavioral, academic, accommodations) and connect with Instructors, Mentors, and Program Manager, as needed.
  • Assist in coordinating study sessions and crafting student/program issue solutions
  • Attend live cohorts twice a week as well as support guided practice sessions
  • Collaborate with instructional, career services, and other functional staff to ensure course delivery run smoothly
  • Plan and lead community-building initiatives
  • Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of student retention initiatives (e.g. tech panels, guided review sessions etc.)
  • Hold group coaching sessions with students to help them succeed through our courses, providing guidance on areas including time management, study habits, emotional support, and overcoming challenges students face in and out of the classroom
  • Document all interactions in the appropriate institutional systems
  • Review key course metrics on a regular basis, you will need to coordinate with the team on how to improve on feedback, as well as escalate larger issues to the program manager
    • Student Experience (Satisfaction Surveys)
    • Student Engagement
    • Graduation Rate
  • Contribute to relevant projects in areas such as documentation, data collection, and process improvement
  • Support the Career Success and Employer Relations team to deliver outstanding career outcomes to students, including coordinating class speakers and reviewing resumes, cover letters, etc.
  • Complete other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

We think you are a great candidate if you have:

  • 3+ years of experience directly managing programs (in high-touch customer-facing roles) in fast-paced higher education, startup, and/or technology industries
  • Great attention to detail and project management skills
  • High empathy and excellent interpersonal and conflict-resolution skills
  • Worked in a role where motivating others was essential to your success
  • A track record of delivering outstanding customer/student satisfaction
  • The ability to operate and execute independently, while collaborating with internal teams and leadership to get the support you need to drive success
  • Comfort operating in ambiguity and providing structure to blue-sky thoughts
  • Passion for creating positive outcomes in people’s lives through education
  • Experience working with and supporting diverse, underrepresented and/or low-income populations

We think you will be an exceptional candidate if you also have:

  • Deep experience working with adult students within an educational setting
  • Experience in the coding boot camp, higher ed, or OPM industry
  • Talent in community building and experience doing so in a remote environment

Colorado and New York Equal Pay For Equal Work Act disclosure:

The expected compensation for this role for candidates from Colorado and New York is $54,000-68,000 annually, plus benefits, for candidates who fulfill the qualifications for the role. Candidates whose qualifications are above those listed are encouraged to apply as well. All final offers to candidates will be based on that candidate's unique experience and skillset, and not all candidates will qualify for the top of the salary range.

#LI-REMOTE

results.title: Data Engineer II-Infrastructure
results.description:
THE PURPOSE:

The Data Engineer works within the Data Solutions organization on critical reporting, visualization, and analysis initiatives. Reporting spans from custom ad-hoc requests to scheduled jobs to supporting our growing data warehouse, and building our future cloud analytics platform. The developer must be able to communicate to business users the exact scope of metrics as well as the confidence and quality of the data in reports.

THE ROLE:

  • Work directly with the business users to understand the reporting needs and lead business users to practical solutions
  • Help translate business requirements into specification documents to track and perform analysis of new and existing site features
  • Understand the necessity of data quality and requirement for confidence of accuracy of any reports
  • Develop/monitor/maintain new reports, dashboards, visualizations, procedures, data structures and databases
  • Design data pipelines and maintain data pipelines in cloud or on-premise environments
  • Design data schema, perform data transformations, enrichments, and manipulations with efficiency and reusability in mind
  • Planning, conducting and directing the analysis of complex business problems and projects

THE CANDIDATE:· 

  • Understand data structures and algorithms. Understanding of basic statistics (confidence intervals, statistical significance, etc)
  • Experience in working with large size data sets (Billions of rows/Petabytes of data)
  • Experience in working with various data sources (ODBC, flat files, etc)
  • Experience working with and designing complex data schemas
  • Strong skills in SQL
  • Development experience in Java and/or Python
  • Experience with SQL query performance optimization
  • Strong skills Experience with Apache Big Data Frameworks (Hadoop/EMR/Databricks, Spark, Hive)
  • Strong experience with Spark performance optimization and troubleshooting
  • Experience with Kafka and event driven architectures
  • Familiarity with workflow scheduling/orchestration tools (Airflow, Jenkins)
  • Experience with AWS
  • Experience with Tableau, Looker, Power BI and or other Self Service Analytical tools.
  • Experience with OLAP Cubing technologies like SSAS or AtScale
  • Implemented Redshift, Snowflake, Azure Data Warehouse, ADLS, S3, Kafka, Presto, EMR, Databricks, or Data Lake Architecture in one or more public clouds in a Production Large Scale environment.

TO BE SUCCESSFUL YOU WILL BE:

  • Highly motivated with a great attitude and desire to dive into raw data to understand trends in behavior to find insights
  • Curious and passionate about data and data insights that relate to our business needs.
  • Excellent at multitasking who can execute multiple requests and reports under tight timelines
  • Inquisitive, self-starter, able to work autonomously
  • Able to work in a fast-paced dynamic startup like environment
  • Detail-oriented tactician who strives for perfection
  • Strong verbal and written communication (and listening) skills
  • Excellent reading comprehension and attention to detail.
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Strong documentation skills as you code (Jira, Confluence)d

As a Data Engineer, your day-to-day tasks will include:

  • Helping us leverage large-scale data stores and data infrastructure by building out data pipelines, streams, and utilities in Spark and other technologies for feedback to our business systems, partners, or users
  • Developing robust, low latency and fault tolerant pipelines to support business critical systems
  • Aggregating key metrics for business partners to inform key decisions
  • Working with cloud technologies to build and deploy your applications

Environment

Can work effectively on a small and nimble team, no trouble context-switching

Education

B.S./M.S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or 3+ years of equivalent experience

LOCATION: Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Flex/Hybrid, or Fully Remote

Remote work is available in: Alabama, Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Hawaii, Illinois, Iowa, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, North Carolina, New Jersey, Nevada, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina,Tennessee, Texas, or Utah.

Slickdeals Compensation, Benefits, Perks:
  • Competitive salary based on your experience
  • Equity, become a Slickdeals stakeholder
  • Platinum level medical benefits
  • Dental, Vision, & Life Insurance
  • 401K matching above the industry standard
  • 10 vacation days, 10 paid holidays, & 48 hours of sick leave
  • Professional Development Reimbursement Program, and LinkedIn Learning Membership

Work Authorization

Candidates must be eligible to work in the United States.

Slickdeals is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other protected status. results.title: Business Analyst for Risk
results.description:

  • English proficiency

results.title: Digital Journalist/Writer
results.description:
Only One is the digital home for the ocean conservation movement. We leverage the power of technology and storytelling to catalyze a global audience of activists and donors. Our world-class content inspires new audiences, and our technology platform connects them with simple but effective ways to take action. We mobilize a global ocean audience to make meaningful impacts on marine life, the climate crisis, and the communities most impacted by threats to the ocean.

About the Digital Journalist/Writer:

Only One is looking for a Digital Journalist/ Writer to join our team as we scale our digital content work to fuel the movement for people and the planet.

The Digital Journalist/Writer will... 

  • Project manage all creative briefs across the organization to identify key messaging, messaging hierarchy, and call to action for all video content.

  • Ideate around script structure and fully own all script writing for the organization around  ongoing and new video pieces (videos for social media, Youtube, and additional platforms as requested).

  • Manage all research, data gathering, and fact-checking for content pieces.

  • Lead copywriting efforts in support of content distribution (emails, memos, captions, video copy, website copy).

  • Facilitate ongoing communication and coordination with our Production team.

  • Work closely with our Growth and Product teams to project manage and support the execution of creative briefs.

About you:

The Digital Journalist/Writer is a dynamic and proactive individual. They are passionate about telling complex stories innovatively and engagingly. Problem-solving is a core strength. They are someone who has experience with written communication, script-writing, and copywriting. A passion for climate and environmental justice and the oceans is important, even if their professional experience has yet to be in that space. Attention to detail and thorough research, and fact-checking skills are a must.

The Digital Journalist/Writer is... 

  • Creative and digital-first, passionate about the digital landscape and online media platforms, and has an eye for new upcoming trends.

  • Experienced in digital media and content creation.

  • An excellent writer, fluent in English with strong communication and research skills. Additional languages are a plus.

  • Experienced in script writing and skilled at engagingly communicating complex topics.

  • Committed to executing with high attention to detail and able to manage multiple projects and partnerships across various relationships while working in a fast-paced environment.

  • Familiarity with the video production process and video editing tools is a plus.

 

Location

This is a full-time remote position.

         

Salary: $60,000 - $75,000
The salary range referenced is based on US resident applicants only.

 

What We Offer:

  • Fully remote work set up to allow flexibility for your own working style.
  • Stipends for personal learning development.
  • Competitive salary + benefits.
  • 3+ weeks guaranteed PTO.

 



Only One is committed to building a workforce composed of individuals with diverse backgrounds, abilities, and identities. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. results.title: QA Engineer (English)
results.description:
Jooble — is a Ukrainian IT company whose product is used by more than 90 million monthly users in 69 countries all around the world.

Jooble's Product — a worldwide employment website that is the second most visited employment service in the world and is among 500 top visited websites globally, according to SimilarWeb.

Jooble is a remote-first company. We believe that talented people can create cool projects no matter where they are.

Our purpose — Help people all over the world find their dream jobs!

Development culture at Jooble
At Jooble, we strive to create high-quality code. Therefore, we follow coding standards agreed within the development team and conduct timely and effective code reviews. To ensure that our software meets business requirements, we apply TDD, DDD, and BDD techniques. Also, our developers often take part in pair/mob programming sessions to brainstorm ideas, design the best solutions, and share expertise within the team.

We regularly conduct Tech talks where we share knowledge on implementing new development approaches and solving challenging engineering issues. And on Product Sprint Demos, we sync on the overall progress of the whole product. We carefully track the progress on tasks in Jira, which provides clarity and transparency of the development process. The team of Technical Writers keep our internal knowledge base in Confluence up to date. Opportunities to make an impact.

We are looking for a QA engineer (Manual) who will bring new expertise and implications to the testing process.

For the permanent improvement testing process, we are looking for a QA specialist who:

  • Has experience of 2 years with commercial projects;
  • Offers new technical solutions and is ready to implement them;
  • Wants to work on a world-class project.

Requirements:

  • Ability to write QA documentation: compiling test cases, user scripts, checklists;
  • Experience in Web UI, web services, and API testing;
  • Strong knowledge of SQL;
  • Experience with Postman / Swagger;
  • Usage of version control systems: Git, SVN;
  • Ability to competently describe the bug report and lead the life cycle of the bug;
  • Experience in any kind of defect tracking systems (Jira / Redmine);
  • Knowledge of English at a level not lower than Upper-intermediate.

Responsibilities:

  • Requirements analysis;
  • Testing process planning, time evaluation;
  • Feature testing;
  • Writing test artifacts;
  • Site release control.

Why Jooble?

  • You are free to choose the location of your workspace;
  • Financial assistance in case of medical need;
  • The 8-hours working day, the beginning time of which you may choose on your own;
  • We supply you with all the necessary equipment for a comfortable working experience;
  • 20 vacation days + 4 additional days to your vacation per year;
  • 4 sick days per year without the need for sick leaves.

If in the job description you see yourself and eagerly want to become a member of our team, please send us your CV and our recruiter will reach you.

http://hiring.jooble.org/

results.title: Junior Recruiter- Life Cycle Assessment
results.description:
About Vaayu

Vaayu is on a mission to decarbonize retail by helping brands (from fashion and beauty to consumer goods, health and beyond) to track, cut and credibly communicate their climate impact in real time. Our science-based platform provides granular, automated and accurate carbon calculations, powered by over 600,000 activity-based data points that make it easy for brands to understand their emissions and take action throughout the value chain to meet their reduction targets. We believe in the power of technology as a force for good and are looking for game-changers from across Europe (or equivalent time zones) who share our vision of helping retailers reduce 1 gigaton of emissions by 2030. If you want to work at a purpose-driven startup and be part of a team defining state-of-the-art technology that drives down carbon emissions at scale, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Our Values

results.title: Senior UX Designer
results.description:

The global private equity space is quickly expanding with net asset value having grown seven-fold since 2002. That's almost double the growth in public equity markets. results.title: Data Visualization Consultant
results.description:
Prominence is looking for the best data visualization specialists in healthcare to join our Analytics team.


Who We Are

Prominence is a healthcare technology strategy and implementation firm, focused on helping the nation’s leading healthcare organizations to do more with their data. Founded by former Epic managers, we understand the technology landscape in healthcare and provide IT staffing, advisory services, and analytics solutions to create robust data ecosystems that support clinical workflows, automate operational processes, and expedite research. Whether it’s guiding a technology implementation, establishing governance principles, or developing leading edge analytics, we help our customers make sense out of the mountain of data at their fingertips in order to deliver higher quality care at a lower cost.

Ranked as a best place to work over 27 times (and counting!), Prominence’s culture provides consultants with a supportive environment that allows you to innovate and grow your career in healthcare IT. Additional information is available on our website.


Your Role

Our consultants guide our customers through complex technology requirements to summit the challenge at hand. You will need to be able to create order out of chaos, and compile ambiguous information into tactical action plans.

Our ideal team members are humble, smart, and driven to ensure our customer’s success. This includes a passion to deliver high-quality results, while teaching our counterparts how to fish and grow the skills needed to support and expand upon the deliverables of our projects.

If this sounds like you, and you meet the requirements below, we encourage you to apply. If you know of someone else how would be a great fit, let us know.

Requirements

As a user interface designer you will design and develop analytics applications in one of our BI platforms, creating informative visualizations designed to solve unique customer problems. Ideal candidates will have a creative and analytic mindset and a demonstrated desire and ability to tackle new and unfamiliar challenges.

This position is a full-time, salaried position with benefits. There is no relocation required. Candidates are required to have a suitable home office to operate from.


Key Responsibilities

A visualization specialist’s primary responsibility includes designing and developing analytics applications in our BI platforms, including Tableau, QlikSense, Qlik View, and PowerBI. Expectations include:

  • Working closely with our healthcare customers to understand visualization requirements and provide best practice recommendations
  • Interpreting dashboard requirements and goals and translating into charts and dashboards that tell a cohesive story and solve complex problems
  • Designing and producing mockups for new dashboards to gather early feedback from end users
  • Coaching healthcare organizations on visualization build and UI best practices
  • Troubleshooting and resolving technical visualization build issues
  • Developing and refining visualization best practices, standard processes, and documentation
  • Learning new BI visualization tools and refining standards as the healthcare analytics industry evolves
  • Experience developing in one or more of the following BI platforms: Tableau, QlikView, Qlik Sense, or Power BI (Data preparation experience not required)
  • Ability to learn and master new BI platforms quickly
  • Knowledge of data visualization best practices
  • Ability to interpret business and visualization requirements and translate into a tangible deliverable
  • Strong communication skills; ability to lead visualization scoping sessions and demos with stakeholders at various levels
  • Experience in successfully balancing and prioritizing work across multiple customers and teams simultaneously


Minimum Qualifications
  • Experience developing in one or more of the following BI platforms: Tableau, QlikView, Qlik Sense, or Power BI (Data preparation experience not required)
  • Ability to learn and master new BI platforms quickly
  • Knowledge of data visualization best practices
  • Ability to interpret business and visualization requirements and translate into a tangible deliverable
  • Strong communication skills; ability to lead visualization scoping sessions and demos with stakeholders at various levels
  • Experience in successfully balancing and prioritizing work across multiple customers and teams simultaneously

Desired Qualifications
  • Healthcare industry knowledge and experience
  • Entry level exposure to or experience in one or more coding languages (SQL, Cache, Python, C#, etc.)


Success Criteria

Successful team members at Prominence display the following:

  • High degree of professionalism; treats others with respect, keeps commitments, builds trust within a team, works with integrity, and upholds organizational values.
  • Highly organized; able to manage multi-faceted workstreams.
  • Self-motivated; able to maintain schedule, meet deadlines, and monitor your personal work product.
  • Highly adaptable; able to acclimate quickly to new project assignments and work environments.
  • Creative; not paralyzed by problems and able to work collaboratively to find novel solutions.
  • Clear communication skills; ability to clearly convey messaging that resonates with your audience, in clear and concise written and verbal communications.
  • Can smell smoke and anticipate issues before they arise, ability to escalate effectively.
  • Passion to mentor and guide others.

Benefits

Prominence is dedicated to hiring the best and brightest minds in healthcare and maintaining a culture that rewards our employees for following their passion. We are excited to offer the following benefits for this position:

  • Competitive Salaried and Hybrid Compensation Plans
  • Health Care Plan (Medical, HSAs, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Dependent & Health Savings Accounts
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation/Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Training & Development Fund
  • Technology Stipends (for Qualifying Roles)
  • Work From Home
  • Charitable Giving to Causes You Believe In

Employment Eligibility

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.


Commitment to Equal Opportunity

The world’s most talented professionals come from every background. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Prominence will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

If you are smart and good at what you do, come as you are. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.


Partnership Eligibility

Our partnerships are extremely important to us. This online application is not intended for anyone who is currently under a non-compete agreement or has an arrangement that precludes employment at Prominence. We appreciate your help in respecting our partners.

Interested in learning more? Apply below to connect with our Talent team about immediate openings and future consulting projects.

results.title: Customer Support Specialist
results.description:
About Mangomint

At Mangomint, we’re building next-generation software that’s optimizing how salons and spas manage their business. Our platform is used daily by thousands of salon and spa professionals in the U.S. and Canada to handle everything from appointment booking, staff management, payment processing, and so much more.

Backed by one of the leading product-led growth VCs, you can be sure the opportunity to work at Mangomint is one filled with possibilities.

We’re still a pretty small team but we’re doing really BIG things. We’re currently working remotely with the occasional meetup every few months. Overall, we’re a fun, accepting, and hard-working group of people that care a lot about bringing in other amazing people as we grow!


About the Role

At Mangomint, our customers are everything. Because of that, we have the standard of providing no less than top-tier customer support to our clients. When our clients have questions, they need quick and accurate answers, and our Customer Support Specialists provide just that. Our customers have high expectations of us and we have high expectations of our Customer Service Specialists. Some of the things you can expect in this role are:

  • Responding to customer support messages from our customers primarily through chat but also over a phone call at times
  • Continually increasing your Mangomint product knowledge so you can provide expert-level answers and service
  • Being available on some evenings and weekends (This person will cover support on the weekend every 3 weeks. Please be sure this is something you’d be comfortable with before applying.)
  • The opportunities and growth potential that come with a start up, as well as the sometimes unpredictable hours (We’re a quick-growing company and a small team, so urgent things come up sometimes, especially in support, so we may need last minute help here and there.)

Requirements

What We're Looking For

As previously mentioned, we have high expectations for our Customer Support Specialists. To help you better know if this role is something you could be a fit for, here are some of the things we’re looking for:

  • You live in the Central or Eastern Standard Time zone (CST or EST)
  • You have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a software support position
  • You have an ability to learn incredibly quickly and an “I’ll figure it out” attitude while also not being afraid to ask questions
  • You’re independent and have the ability to work well autonomously and with a team
  • You enjoy working on difficult-to-solve problems, even if it’s in a stressful situation at times
  • You have a LOVE for talking with people from all walks of life and ability to always be respectful and kind, no matter what
  • You are a skilled communicator through writing (Writing is a HUGE part of this role so we need this person to be able to communicate really well through writing.)
  • You having experience with salons and spas (or beauty & wellness in general) would be incredibly helpful

Benefits

What You'll Love about Mangomint

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous monthly wellness budget for gym memberships, yoga, spas, etc.
  • Premium subscription to the Calm app
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Lots of opportunities for career and personal growth
  • Remote work
  • Competitive compensation
  • Supportive environment with fun and respectful culture
  • 401k (no matching…yet)



Mangomint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disibility and genetic information (including family medical history).

  • You have a high level of quality awareness, are communicative and enjoy working in a team.



Additional Information
  • Permanent employment contract
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Work on interesting and dynamic topics in an international team at one of the key partners in the automotive industry
  • Extensive training and development opportunities
  • Open-door culture at all hierarchical levels
  • Flexible working hours
  • Company and team events
  • Work-Life-Balance: 26 vacation days & flexible working hours
  • 100% Remote, Hybrid or On-Site in our new office in Thessaloniki!

We look forward to receiving your application. Please highlight your earliest possible starting date and salary expectation.

For more information about the process you are welcome to contact Kyriakos Kardogeros (+49 89 31813 119).

results.title: Engineering Manager
results.description:
Who we are: 

Nacelle is a composable commerce platform provider that allows brands and retailers to easily syndicate commerce and content data to multiple heads, endpoints and channels by transforming, storing and reindexing data in real-time. With Nacelle, companies can future-proof their business by composing the commerce stack they want — giving them the agility needed to build unique and dynamic shopping experiences, while optimizing business operations for growth. Nacelle is a venture-backed company with over $75 million raised from institutional investors including Tiger Global, Index Ventures and iNovia. For more information, go to nacelle.com

The role:

We are seeking an experienced Engineering Manager who is a fast learner, a hard worker, has a knack for creative problem-solving and is a low-ego team player. You will join Nacelle’s core development team to develop, build, and maintain new features for our product. You should be comfortable letting your tech leads take true ownership of projects while keeping enough eye on things to make sure the train stays on track.

In this role you will:
  • Advocate for, and execute on our one-on-one, coaching-centric engineering culture.
  • Coaching engineers to be better at what they do by reducing cycle time, blockers, and defect rates.
  • Work closely with Product and Design to roll out new, high impact solutions.
  • Work with the talent acquisition team to hire new software engineers, building teams that are better than the sum of their parts.
  • Be the technical “spirit guide”, leading engineers by example and guiding technical direction.
The impact you will have:

In your first 90 days:

  • Build relationships with your team and their team members.
  • Build and maintain good working relationships with key leaders in; Product, Engineering, and Customer Success.
  • Foster a safe and supportive work environment for engineers by:
    • Enabling a fail-fast mindset (fail-learn-improve cycle).
    • Building trust within and across teams.
    • Providing safe channels for feedback.

In your first 6 months:

  • Contribute to the company's technical vision.
  • Collaborate with your peer managers, lead engineers, and Director of Engineering on setting and improving engineering processes, standards, and practices.

In your first year:

  • Lead your team(s) to implement and deliver a large product feature.
  • Hold yourself and your team accountable for;
    • Its commitments.
    • Following and improving processes.
We would love to hear from you if:
  • You have 2+ years as a people manager.
  • You have 5+ years of experience in a software engineering position, contributing code to an active codebase.
  • You have 2+ years of collaborative experience with recruiting where you build high quality diverse and inclusive teams.
  • You have 2+ years working with matrix structured teams and squads.
  • You have 3+ years of engineering experience at a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) provider.
We’d be really excited if you have:
  • Experience working at a venture backed, fast growing startup.
  • Remote work experience.
  • Proficiency with at least one modern programming language such as Javascript / Typescript (Node), Go, Java.
  • AWS, GCP, Azure or similar cloud infrastructure experience.
  • Experience building web based applications.

 

If you meet most of the criteria for this position, we would still love to hear from you! We believe in fostering talent, growing and providing training to our team as we believe great human beings come first and building skillsets can happen over time.

At Nacelle, we strive to promote a culture where all employees feel supported and comfortable to provide constructive feedback in ways that we can continue to grow and practice our values of "forever learning, ownership, honesty and integrity, and teamwork." 

Nacelle is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. 

Nacelle is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities who may require additional assistance in engaging in our application and interview process. Please feel free to reach out to Nacelle's Talent Acquisition Team at TA@getnacelle.com if you need any assistance completing our application or need accommodations during your interview process.

results.title: Frontend Software Engineer
results.description:
Description

Claroty empowers the world's largest enterprises to secure their cyber-physical systems across industrial (OT), healthcare (IoMT), and enterprise (IoT) environments: the Extended Internet of Things (XIoT). The Claroty Platform integrates with customers’ existing infrastructure to provide a full range of controls for visibility, risk and vulnerability management, threat detection, and secure remote access. Our platform is deployed by hundreds of organizations at thousands of sites across all seven continents.

Launched by the famed Team8 foundry in 2015, Claroty is headquartered in New York City, with employees across the Americas, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Tel Aviv. Claroty has raised $635 million in funding from the world’s largest investment firms and industrial automation vendors – including SoftBank, Bessemer Venture Partners, Rockwell Automation, Schneider Electric, and Siemens – making it the most well-funded industrial cybersecurity company.

At Claroty, we are looking to hire individuals who embody our core values: People First, Customer Obsession, Strive for Excellence, and Integrity.

Claroty is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment for all. We encourage applications from candidates of ALL diverse backgrounds, and special accommodations are available upon request in all phases of the hiring process.

We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Senior Frontend Engineer to join our team and help us build and enhance a cutting-edge enterprise OT/IOT Threat detection solution. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of end-to-end features, from design and architecture to development and deployment. You will work closely with a diverse team of developers, QA engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to create fast and responsive UI, solid architecture, and well-designed components.



Responsibilities:

  • Lead the design and implementation of end-to-end features for our enterprise OT remote access solution
  • Take ownership of features from design to deployment, including architecture and development
  • Build and maintain a web application, including component definition, reuse, and testing
  • Work on both frontend and backend aspects of features
  • Master a diverse technology stack, including Angular, Typescript, and  Python3
  • Drive product and technical innovation, as well as software development best practices
  • Mentor team members for best practices and excellence



Region:
Tel Aviv

Requirements
  • 6+ years of experience developing enterprise-grade web applications
  • Strong understanding of Angular framework and its core concepts
  • Strong expertise in Typescript
  • Proficiency with RxJS
  • Experience with state management architectures such as Redux or MobX
  • Strong team player who can thrive in a fast-paced environment and collaborate effectively with others
  • Self-starter with the ability to take on new technologies and research and implement new solutions
  • Adaptable, flexible, and driven by integrity and a sense of ownership
  • Experience with backend development, preferably using Python, is a plus
  • Experience with relational databases is a plus
  • Cybersecurity and Linux experience is a plus

 

If you have a passion for building innovative web applications and are eager to make a significant impact on our team, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
